page.title: 14Brocklesby Station
page.content: Brocklesby station as a station is almost derelict now.It is owned by British Rail & is a listed building. The Prince Regent in the 1860's alighted here on his way to visit the Yarboroughs at Brocklesby Park. This, and also the Earl of Yarborough owning much stock in the Railway Companies led to elaborate station buildings and first class waiting room.These are now for sale. The houses attached to the station were formerly occupied by railway employees. The houses were sold in the 1962 Beeching cuts,one of them to a railway employee. About 8 passenger trains stop here everyday.Few people get on or off. Many freight trains use this line. Iron ore from Immingham is taken to B.S.C. at Scunthorpe.Oil and Coal pass here on their journey inland.
